Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, probably type A; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of torso of armed figure wearing short chiton with folds (dab of added red) and scabbard on baldric (faded red on both) to left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "15" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0624) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
